page.title: 05Wivelsfield - Ecology (2)
page.content:
{Conservation - Abbotsleigh Estate} Day old Mallards are bought in, kept at 80 degrees and fed on concentrates. At 8 weeks they are dispersed around the ponds on the estate. Game birds are also bought in at 6 to 12 weeks.
Magpies, jays and foxes have to be kept down or they will attack the birds. At one time the estate was overrun with rabbits but they are not now a problem.
A stream was dammed in 1965 to form a pond which is stocked with carp,roach, and tench. A second lake was formed in 1979. There are up to 600 ducks and geese on the water.
There is buckweed in a clearing for pheasants and wildlife.There is a badger's earth and trail near a pond.
